abstract: <jats:p>The taxonomic status of the European <jats:italic>Hoplodrina octogenaria</jats:italic> (Goeze, 1781) is discussed and its partly sympatric sister species, <jats:italic>Hoplodrina alsinides</jats:italic> (Costantini, 1922) <jats:bold>sp. rev.</jats:bold>, is separated and re-described based on morphological and molecular taxonomic evidence. The adults and their genitalia are illustrated and DNA barcodes, as well as genome-wide single nucleotide polymorphism data collected by fractional genome sequencing (ddRAD), of the two species are provided.</jats:p>
title: Revision of the genus Hoplodrina Boursin, 1937 (Lepidoptera, Noctuidae, Xyleninae). I. Hoplodrina octogenaria (Goeze, 1781) and its sister species H. alsinides (Costantini, 1922) sp. rev. in Europe
